body.p: I am much obliged to you for your note, and for your kind attention. I am not likely to see Mrs WilbyMaria A. Wilby, author of A Cry from the Opprest and Other Poems, 1838, dedicated, with complaints of calumny, to the Lord Chancellor: see Pilgrim Letters 12 (Addenda), p. 576n. whom I have never seen in my life; but when I sent the Petition to her for her signature, I was extremely careful to caution her against expecting that anything would come of its presentationHer husband’s death in 1818 left Mrs Wilby and her children financially distressed. The petition was possibly to the Royal Literary Fund or, since CD met Ewart, 3 May 41 (Pilgrim Letters 2, p. 278), to discuss her situation, a request to Parliament for a pension. – I repeatedly stated the same thing to her daughter when she asked me to draw it – and I fully believe that they perfectly understand the real state of the case.
